intro: Draba atlantica var. maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. It has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowering period occurs in early spring. This variety is noted for its resilience and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
